task_description:
# Add RFI Dashboard Widget

**Linear Issue:** [BUI-107](https://linear.app/builder-project/issue/BUI-107/add-rfi-dashboard-widget)
**Priority:** No priority
**Status:** Backlog


## Description

## User Story

As a user, I want to see RFI statistics on my dashboard so that I can quickly assess outstanding items.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Create `RFIStatsWidget` component
- [ ] Display counts:
  - Open RFIs (awaiting response)
  - Overdue RFIs (past due date)
  - Answered today
  - Total closed this month
- [ ] Visual indicators (icons, colors)
- [ ] Click to navigate to RFI list with filter
- [ ] Add widget to main dashboard

## Labels

frontend, dashboard, rfi

patterns.api_service: All API services use axios with apiClient from api/client.ts, return typed Promise responses
patterns.component_structure: Functional components with TypeScript, React Hooks (useState, useEffect), MUI components
patterns.dashboard_widgets: Dashboard uses KPICard components with title, value, icon, color props. Grid layout with responsive columns
patterns.navigation: useNavigate from react-router-dom, nested routes under /projects/:projectId/
patterns.data_fetching: API calls in useEffect, loading state with setLoading, error handling with try-catch and toast notifications
patterns.rfi_api: rfiApi.getSummary(projectId) returns RFISummary interface with open_count, overdue_count, answered_count, closed_count

existing_implementations.description: RFI API service already exists with getSummary endpoint. Dashboard uses KPICard components for metrics. Navigation patterns established with useNavigate hook.
relevant_files: frontend/src/api/rfi.ts - RFI API service with getSummary method and RFISummary interface
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx - Dashboard using KPICard components for metrics display
frontend/src/components/ui/Card.tsx - KPICard component definition with icon, color, trend support
